title: Brazil former president sentenced to nearly 9 years in jail for corruption
description: Fernando Collor de Mello Collor, who led Brazil from 1990 to 1992, was already a tarnished figure: he resigned from that office to avoid impeachment, also over corruption allegations.

title: Jordan and Saudi Arabia: A royal and political marriage
description: The Jordanian crown prince weds a Saudi architect on Thursday, after years of tense relations between the two countries.

title: In Turkey, the bitter sweet relief of Syrian refugees after Erdogan's victory
description: The presence in Turkey of 3.6 million exiles who fled the war in Syria has led to xenophobic rhetoric from presidential candidates. The refugees are still threatened with deportation.

title: US unveils new $300 million arms package for Ukraine
description: The latest US aid package includes rockets for the High Mobility Artillery Rocket System (HIMARS) and more tank ammunition ahead of Ukraine's expected counteroffensive.

title: Japan moves away from pacifist ideal in the face of looming threats
description: Given rising tensions in East Asia, Tokyo doubled its defense budget and changed its military doctrine, drifting from the stance enshrined in the Japanese Constitution.

title: NATO-led peacekeepers increase security after violent Kosovo clashes
description: Hundreds of Serbians rallied outside Zvecan's town hall for a third consecutive day after violent clashes left more than 80 people wounded on Monday.

title: How New Yorkers working from home is harming the city
description: With employees gradually moving to a four-day week, with offices deserted on Fridays, urban services are taking a hit.

title: Commission of inquiry into 'Russian influence' sparks outrage in Poland
description: The opposition and many legal experts are criticizing a law that came into force on Wednesday, fearing interference in the fall 2023 parliamentary elections. Washington and Brussels have expressed similar concerns.

title: French pension reform: Repeal bill sparks institutional feud
description: The text submitted by an opposition group will be examined by lawmakers on June 8. Macron's party is expected to oppose an article reinstating the retirement age to 62.

title: Macron calls on West to offer 'tangible' security guarantees to Ukraine
description: Speaking at a forum in Bratislava, the French president stressed that Ukraine 'is today protecting Europe.'

title: Putin breaks silence following Moscow drone attack
description: Media and public reaction was minimal. But in a brief exchange, the Russian leader accused Ukraine (which denies any responsibility for the attack) of seeking to 'terrify Russia.'

title: With online meetings, diplomacy is saving time but losing rapport
description: The digitization of communication precipitated by the constraints of the Covid-19 epidemic offers certain advantages but robs diplomats of crucial informal moments during official meetings.

title: Environmental threats increase in Brazil despite Lula's promises
description: On Tuesday, the Brazilian lower house passed a law restricting the rights of indigenous peoples on their own land. The law comes on the heels of other worrying measures.

title: Beirut's Sursock Museum, a showcase for Lebanese art, reopens
description: The Lebanese institution reopens its doors after two years of renovation. The building was severely damaged by the explosion of August 4, 2020.

title: Macron blames Kosovo authorities for violent clashes
description: After violent outbursts followed local election, the French president said that 'we very clearly notified the Kosovar authorities that it was a mistake to proceed with these elections.'

title: Artificial intelligence revives chip industry competition
description: As demand for electronic chips keeps growing, Nvidia of the United States stands out. The company's market capitalization exceeded $1,000 billion on Tuesday.

title: DeSantis and Trump confrontation kicks off in Iowa
description: Florida's governor launched his grassroots campaign on Tuesday, May 30, near Des Moines, focusing on the culture war and education issues.

title: Markets slump ahead of key debt ceiling Congress vote
description: Investors fear hardline Republicans could vote down a crucial bill to hike the United States' borrowing limit.

title: Paris real estate: Downturn in prices underway and set to accelerate
description: Sales of existing homes in the Paris region fell by 22% year-on-year in the first quarter of 2023. For July, the Chamber of Notaries is forecasting a 5% annual drop in apartment prices.

title: Djokovic message on Kosovo 'not appropriate,' French sports minister says
description: The Serbian tennis star wrote 'Kosovo is the heart of Serbia' on a camera after a game in Paris on Monday, amid clashes between ethnic Albanians and Serbs in the territory.

title: What we know about Tuesday's drone attack on Moscow
description: A drone raid hit the Russian capital without causing any casualties. But the attack raises questions.

title: Paris 2024: The untenable promise of 'climate positive' Games
description: Behind the objective to reduce the carbon footprint of the Olympics by half compared to London 2012 and Rio 2016, the organizers are facing many uncertainties that put in doubt their statements promoting the image of green Olympics.

title: Brazil lawmakers vote to limit demarcation of Indigenous reserves
description: Scientists say Indigenous lands represent highly important buffer zones against deforestation in the Amazon.

title: DeSantis kicks off presidential campaign in Iowa, calling for 'revival of American greatness'
description: In recent months the governor of Florida has sought to position himself as a defender of the ultra-conservative base that has taken over the Republican Party.

title: North Korea says its attempt to launch first spy satellite ends in failure
description: The launch prompted an 'wartime' evacuation alert to be sent to residents of Seoul, only for authorities to quickly say it was 'incorrectly issued'.
